page.title: Cloud in a Jar
page.p: When worn as a bauble it gives the wearer the ability to double-jump.
This item is a tribute to Terraria.

page.title: Slime Balloon
page.p: When worn as a bauble it gives the wearer the ability to jump higher.
This item is a tribute to Terraria.

page.title: Cloud in a Slime Balloon
page.p: It combines the effects of Cloud in a Jar and Slime Balloon
This item is a tribute to Terraria.

page.title: Ender Cloud in a Slime Balloon
page.p: It's a better version of Cloud in a Slime Balloon in that it makes you jump even higher and gives you a triple jump.
This item is a tribute to Terraria.

page.title: Gem of the Winds
page.p: When worn as a bauble it gives the wearer the ability to walk and run faster.

page.title: Glider
page.p: When worn as a bauble it gives the wearer the ability to glide and fall slowly. This also prevents damage from falling.

page.title: Valkyrie Wings
page.p: It combines the effects of Gem of the Winds and Glider and improves them.

page.title: Spiked Soles
page.p: When worn as a bauble it gives the wearer the ability to walk up blocks.
This item is a tribute to Terraria.

page.title: Climing Claws
page.p: When worn as a bauble it gives the wearer the ability to climb at walls by sneaking. Also the wearer can slide down walls.
This item is a tribute to Terraria.

page.title: Climing Gear
page.p: It combines the effects of Spiked Soles and Climbing Claws with improved climbing speed.
This item is a tribute to Terraria.

page.title: Amulet of Breath
page.p: When worn as a bauble it prevents the wearer from drowning.

page.title: Flippers
page.p: When worn as a bauble it gives the wearer the ability to swim faster in water.

page.title: Rune of Flowing Water
page.p: When worn as a bauble it increases the wearers mining speed when they are in water.

page.title: Amulet of the Tides
page.p: It combines the effects of Amulet of Breath, Flippers and Rune of Flowing Water and improves them.

page.title: Fireproof Cloak
page.p: When worn as a bauble it gives the wearer a resistance to fire damage and prevents burning.

page.title: Talisman of the Nether
page.p: When worn as a bauble it prevents damage from standing on magma blocks. Also Nether Portals will teleport the wearer instantaneously.

page.title: Cloak of the Nether
page.p: It combines the effects of Fireproof Cloak and Talisman of the Nether and improves them. Also it reduces damage from lava.

page.title: Rocket Pack
page.p: When worn as a bauble it gives the wearer the ability to accelerate with the Elytra by pressing forward. This effectively allows infinite flight.

page.title: Miner's Bracelet
page.p: When worn as a bauble it increases the wearers mining speed. This effect is cumulative.

page.title: Ring of Saturation
page.p: When worn as a bauble the wearer's hunger bar will periodically be filled slightly. This effect is cumulative.

page.title: Ring of Sunlight
page.p: When worn as a bauble the wearer will have an aura of light. This is the bauble equivalent of the Sunstone.

page.title: Sunstone
page.p: Right-click to toggle this item on or off. When it is on will the owner have an aura of light while the item is in their hotbar. The bauble equivalent of this item is the Ring of Sunlight.

page.title: Ender Plate
page.p: Right-click to toggle this item on or off. When it is on will the owner can walk on air. He can go upwards by jumping and downwards by sneaking while the item is in their hotbar.

page.title: Blazing Orb
page.p: This item is an infinite furnace fuel. It periodically starts glowing. While it glows it can be put into furnaces. It will then be able to perform 1 smelting operation every time it glows without being used up.

page.title: Tome of Transmutation
page.p: This book can be used to transmute items using experience levels. Click the "?"-button in the upper-left corner to see a list of the available recipes.

page.title: Portable Ender Rift
page.p: Right-click this item to open your ender chest's inventory whereever you are.

Item Transport

page.title: Player Interface
page.p: When something would be interacting with this block's inventory it will instead interact with the inventory of the player who is standing on top of it.

page.title: Proximity Sensor
page.p: This block will give a redstone output depending on the distance of the closest player. The closer the player the stronger the signal. It's maximum range can be changed.

This also changes the precision of the redstone signal. The smaller the range the more precise the redstone signal. The power of the redstone signal changes in a linear fashion depending on the player's distance.

page.title: Storage Matrix
page.p: This block has an inventory with 256 slots. It has no GUI. Dismantle it with a wrench to have it keep it's inventory.

page.title: Set Provider
page.p: This block helps you provide sets of items. A set of items can be defined in the filter. It will only push sets one at a time and only if there's enough items. Use a wrench to configure it's I/O-sides.

page.title: Iron Factory
page.p: This block will produce 1 iron ingot every 2.5 minutes. It's purpose is to lower the server's load because people can use it instead of iron golem farms.

page.title: Automatic Work Station
page.p: It's an improved Work Station. It has 9 extra inventory slots and is capable of crafting automatically. Use a wrench to configure it's I/O-sides.

page.title: Blast Pad
page.p: When this block receives a redstone pulse it will blast the players standing on top of it upwards. The power of the blast depends on the power of the redstone signal.

page.title: Jump Pad
page.p: This block functions as a teleporter. If you don't specify the target locations it will teleport you to the closest Jump Pad straight upwards as soon as you jump. The default maximum range is 256 blocks.
If you sneak it teleports you to the closest Jump Pad straight down. You can also right-click it to insert Location Modules to target a specific Jump Pad in the same dimension.

page.title: Hover Pad
page.p: While this block is powered it will push all players within a specific unobstructed range directly above it upwards. The power of the pushing depends on the power of the redstone signal.

page.title: Item Transmitter
page.p: This block has 9 inventory slots which it will broadcast to up to 3 channels seperate at once. Channels can be specified using Channel Modules.

page.title: Item Receiver
page.p: When interacting with this blocks inventory you instead interact with inventories of up to 3 received channels. Channels can be specified using Channel Modules.

page.title: Remote Inventory Proxy
page.p: When interacting with this blocks inventory you instead access the inventory of the block specified using a Location Module. This works like a Side-Aware Inventory Proxy.

page.title: Channel Modules
page.p: Channel Modules are used to specify channels for wireless item networking.
See also:

page.title: Color Channel Module
page.p: Right-clicking this item shows a GUI. In this GUI you can set a color code to specify a channel.

page.title: Player Channel Module
page.p: Right-clicking this item sets the player to specify a channel. Sneaking and Right-clicking resets the player. This is used for private channels.

page.title: Text Channel Module
page.p: Right-clicking this item shows a GUI. In this GUI you can set a text with up to 20 characters to specify a channel.

page.title: Location Module
page.p: Sneaking and Right-clicking a block sets the location. This location will be used for different things depending on the machine. Sneaking and Right-clicking in the air resets the location.

page.title: Iron Wrench
page.p: Right-click a block to rotate it. Sneak and right-click a machine to dismantle. Some blocks like the Set Provider and the Seed Box can be configured with this item.

page.title: Adventurer's Pickaxe
page.p: This pickaxe improves as you use it. Some upgrades are applied at specific levels. One random upgrade is applied to the pickaxe at every level up. These can be influenced by the types of blocks you mine.

page.title: Level-Specific Upgrades:
page.p: 5 - Mining Level up
10 - Magnetic
15 - Mining Level up
20 - Luck: 1
25 - Mining Level up
30 - Soulbound
35 - Luck: 2
45 - Luck: 3
55 - Luck: 4

page.title: Random Upgrades - Block Type
page.p: Mining Speed - Any
Soft Bonus Speed - Stone
Digging Speed - Shovel Blocks
Ore Vein Mining Size - Ores
Durability increases at each level up.
Craft the pickaxe with the item specified in the tooltip to repair it.

page.title: Mob Containment Devices
page.p: MCDs can be used to capture and transport mobs. Throw them at a valid mob to capture it with a certain chance depending on the MCD's strength.
Not all MCDs can capture hostile mobs though. The MCD will be destroyed if capturing fails. If an MCD contains a mob you can right-click at a block to release the mob.
MCDs are needed to craft Soul Gems.
Any similarity to Nintendo games are really actually absolutely purely incidental.
Mega MCDs can not be crafted but they can appear as dungeon loot.

page.title: Fertilizer
page.p: Get it as an uncommon byproduct of the Composter. It's Bone Meal in better.

page.title: Bandage
page.p: When it is applied it has a strong healing effect that might be removed when you take damage.

page.title: Antidote
page.p: Drinking it removes Poison, Withering, Hunger and Nausea.

page.title: Compost
page.p: Compost is the main product of the Composter. It can be applied to Dirt, Grass or Farmland to yield Compost Soil. Compost Soil makes plants on top of it grow faster.
While Compost Soil slowly degrades over time it makes plants grow significantly faster even on higher degradation levels. Also it does not need a water source to be effective.
Compost with spores has a small chance to yield Mycelium it is applied on grass.
You can also reapply Compost on degraded Compost Soil to reset the degree of degradation.
Compost Soil will turn back into Dirt if it degrades too much.

page.title: Cheese
page.p: It's a tasty food. In fact it's so tasty you can even eat it with a full hunger bar. However plain cheese is not that good of a food.

page.title: Cheese Sandwich
page.p: It's better and tastier than just plain bread.

page.title: Potion of Lumbering
page.p: Drinking it grants a buff that allows breaking wood logs more quickly.

page.title: Potion of Thorns
page.p: Drinking it grants an effect that inflicts a part of direct physical damage taken to the attacker.

page.title: Powder Keg
page.p: Can be filled with up to one stack of gunpowder by right-clicking. It explodes if fire or a redstone signal is applied.
The explosion's strength depends on the amount of gunpowder contained. A whole stack of gunpowder causes a huge explosion. It keeps it's items when broken.

page.title: Composter
page.p: Throw items into the Composter to make it process them. It takes a while to process them though.
It can process most items that are organic.
Don't overflow it or it starts to smell horribly.
It can produce the following items:

page.title: Tree Tap
page.p: Plug it into a tree's logs and attatch a Sap Bottle to harvest it's sap.
Sap can be used as a sugar suplement in crafting recipes.
It's also used for the following:

page.title: Inventory Proxies
page.p: When interacting with this blocks inventory you instead access the inventory of the block that this block is pointing at.
The Side-Aware Proxy respects the side you access the proxy from and also accesses the accessed side of the target. The Regular Proxy just accesses the side that the proxy is pointing at.
The filtered proxy does not respect the side-accessed. However you can specify which items are allowed to go through it.

page.title: Work Station
page.p: The Work Station is a crafting table that keeps it's items. It also has 9 extra slots for handy storage.

page.title: Semi-Solid Block
page.p: It's a transparent block that is only solid when you don't sneak. It's available in all 16 colors.

page.title: Platform
page.p: Platforms are only solid and visible from above as long as you don't sneak. They are available in all 16 colors.

page.title: Launching Arrows
page.p: Launching Arrows explode on impact with an Entity. When they are stuck in the ground they work as mines that trigger on close proximity. Stacking multiple arrows as a mine can be devestating to anyone who comes too close.
There are 3 types of Launching Arrows.

The Slime Arrows' explosions don't deal any entity damage or block damage but knock the player way further than the other types. The can be used for vertical mobility or traps that send the victims flying.
Blast Arrows damage entities but no blocks. They are good for simply attacking enemies.
Creeper arrows deal a lot of damage to entities and blocks. They are nice if you want to blow stuff and people up and cause total mayham.

page.title: Seed Box
page.p: You can insert items into the Seed Box to have them drop down from one of the output sides with special properties depending on the item.

The items will drop straight down without any randomness involved. The output sides can be configured using an iron wrench. The items will drop from a randomly picked unobstructed output side. This block doesn't have an inventory so inserted items are dropped instantaneously.
Seeds and plants dropped from this block will plant themselves on a valid surface.
Bone Meal, Fertilizer and Compost will automatically apply themselves if possible.
Animal feeding items will automatically feed themselves to close animals if possible.

page.title: Ender-Proof Blocks
page.p: Prevents ender teleportation through it.

page.title: Display Case
page.p: A fancy way to display your items. Screw item frames!

page.title: The Convenient Guide
page.p: It's this handy book. It tries it's best to explain you all the stuff in this mod.

page.title: Backpack
page.p: A neat handy backpack with 9 inventory slots. Right-click it to access it's inventory. It can hold anything but other backpacks.

page.title: Storage Crate
page.p: It's a crate with 3 chests worth of inventory space and it makes for a handy compact storage.

page.title: Punji Sticks
page.p: They deal reasonable damage to all living entities that touch it spikes but do not destroy items. The damage dealt penetrates armor. They can face any direction you like.

page.title: Dirt Chunk
page.p: Dirt Chunks are a common byproduct of the Composter. They have no other purpose than making dirt with them.

page.title: Soulgem
page.p: Combining a Mob Containment Device with a diamond yields Soul Gem of the contained entity. The actual entity is destroyed in this process and an empty MCD is returned. Soul Gems are used for crafting with mobs.
